result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Hearing on September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Receipt of Passport surrendered to the Court.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:16 AM Defendant Michael J Sturino in court with attorney Brandon Carlson for attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

The Court addresses the non turn over of the passport.
The Defendant states he does have a passport, however can not find the passport.
The State would like the passport found and turned over to the Clerk's office.
The Court notes that a letter was filed and sent to the Fed as it relates to Notice Regarding US Passport for Criminal Defendant.
The Court admonishes the defendant and orders the Defendant that within 24 hours of finding the passport to turn it over the Clerk's Office.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.

01:27 PM Defendant Michael J Sturino in court with Attorney Brandon Carlson for Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.
WCS - Defendant in compliance, filed by Michael Balda.
WCS Report of Non-Compliance, filed by Michael Balda.
Hearing on July 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on July 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Court grants request, repayment at rate of $75.00 per month commencing September 1, 2022, signed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on June 16, 2022. (BC)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 01:43 PM Defendant Michael J Sturino in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel. Defendant sworn. Court grants request, repayment at rate of $75.00 per month commencing September 1, 2022.  Court adjourns for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Notice Regarding US Passport for Criminal Defendant
The original document name was titled: Notice Regarding US Passport for Criminal Defendant
The original history event date is: 06-10-2022

ADDRESS INFO for Michael J Sturino
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-09-2022)
Prior: 2305 Memorial Drive, Brookfield, WI 53045
Hearing on June 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

COURT ORDERED A $2,000.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $50,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is prohibited from accessing any child exploitation material and any other sexually explicit material through the Internet or by any other means.  Defendant prohibited from contacting a minor over the internet or using a website to gather information about a minor. Defendant is prohibited from intentionally deleting any history from any computer or device that accesses the Internet. Defendant prohibited from using any application where the content automatically deletes upon the recipient opening the content.  Defendant prohibitied from using any apps like Kik, Wikr, etc.  Defendant to have no contact with any child under the age of 18.  However, the Court will allow the defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any grandchildren.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.25 mile of any school or daycare.  The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day of being released. Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.   Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

01:59 PM Defendant Michael J Sturino in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.    Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
